OOC: Any Maximal or Autobot can be part of this

The Maximals and Autobots =
are directed to the meeting area, which is near to the front of the Ark bay=
 area. A podium is set up and there are places for everyone to either stand=
 up or sit down as is their want. 

As everyone moved into position, LEGACY=
, LORD ELDER, WINGSABER, SANTON, TORCA and NOCTORRO come in a take position=
s near the podium itself, but it is the bot known as LEO II that comes up t=
o take the center of the stage. 

He steps up behind the podium and take a =
moment to look at the assembled individuals before him. He stands tall and =
proud, the whites and light browns are caught well in the lights. His form =
is strong and well built and in his face you can see the likeness of OPTIMU=
S PRIME himself. Behind him lay the large fallen forms of OPTIMUS and MEGAT=
RON locked, even in death, in the eternal struggle of good versus evil. 

A=
nd it is in this back drop that LEO turned to face the assembled mechs and =
began to speak. 

"Autobots, Maximals!" LEO's voice is a rich baritone, one=
 that easily carried across the room. "I am sure that you have been all won=
dering just what this meeting is about." He smiled a warm and inviting smil=
e as he looked around the room. "And for those who don't know me, I am LEO =
and have been named a PRIME by the council of elders on Cybertron." He paus=
ed for a moment for that to take affect and then continued, "and what I hav=
e come here to talk about is Earth, and what we are doing here." 

LEO paus=
ed to make sure that everyone was keeping up and then continued, "I have be=
en sent by the high council and have been discussing matters with both Your=
 Lord Elder as well as Legacy, both of whom have been instrumental in catal=
oging events here on Earth, and what has been found we find disturbing."

T=
here was a glance from LORD ELDER to LEO, but it was a nod of agreement, ev=
en from LEGACY there was a very slight nod, his single optic pulsing slight=
ly. 

"Does anyone here know how many ships have crash landed here on this =
planet since you have been here?" LEO stopped for a moment as he looked at =
those in the crowd, his optics turning to look at each of the Maximals and =
Autobots who were present. 

There were some in the audience who tentativel=
y raised a hand and perhaps even a few who raised it with confidence, but m=
ost kept their hands down, unsure. 

"What ever you think that number is, m=
ultiply it several times." LEO PRIME's words were frim and full of convitio=
n, "You have to factor in the Predacons and Decepticons that have crash lan=
ded here too, and then there are the ships that crashed and had no survivor=
s and so may have not been reported, and of course the largest one that cra=
sh landed into the ocean."

LEO PRIME paused for a moment again to let that=
 fact sink in and then he spoke. "Most of these ships contained alien miner=
als, alien metals and alien technologies, objects that have no business bei=
ng here on this planet at this time." 

Gesturing at the audience LEO PRIME=
 asked another question, "Does anyone care to hazard a guess at how many to=
ns of it are here on the Earth now?" 

He paused again to look at the audie=
nce, fewer raising their hands. 

"Or how about the last time there was som=
e major battle and you blew off a piece of someone's armor, or they lost a =
weapon, or perhaps that happened to you?" 

LEO PRIME's optic's brightened =
as he went on, "Has anyone noticed that the humanoids on the planet are beg=
inning to learn from us, learning how to use tools and communicate ideas at=
 a faster rate than they historical should have?"

Slamming his hands down =
on the podium he continued in a stronger voice, "Mechs we are having an imp=
act on this planet, one that we should not be having. The humans have to pr=
oceed unmolested on a planet that is supposed to be in a pristine condition=
 when they inherit it. There should be no leftover smog from our smelting o=
f ore, and it should not be being deprived of the very minerals that the hu=
mans will need to survive. It should not be seeded with technologies that h=
umans should not be able to fathom for another several million years, and w=
e definitely should not be having cities here, complete with internal crime=
 and slums."

LEO straightened as he looked over his audience to be sure th=
at he still had their attention. He nodded at the affect that he had. "YES,=
 we have to stop Unicron and his minions! And YES, we have to round up the =
Predacons and other assorted criminals that are still running around on thi=
s planet. More of which seem to be arriving daily." 

Gesturing at the audi=
ence again LEO sighed, "But we cannot make the Earth our permanent living q=
uarters, at least not yet. We have reports of civilians here, setting up sh=
op . . . setting up families." He paused again to look at the audience, "Th=
is planet belongs to the humans and the other animals that live here, not u=
s. We do not have the right!" 

LEO PRIME leaned into the audience, "If we =
continue on the course that we are now, we are no better than the Predacons=
 who take what they want. We are Maximals and Autobots, we are better than =
that. We are here to defend it, but this planet, this place, it is not our =
home, and we cannot, through our desire to defend it turn it into one, nor =
can we allow the Predacons to do so either."

He straightened, "It is time =
for a change."

(TAG)

Preston
